alert.note: Alert for Flaming Gorge; Rock Springs and Green River (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 12:04PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Sweetwater County through 1245 PM MDT... At 1204 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Lonetree, or 16 miles northwest of Manila, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Sweetwater County, including the following locations... Burntfork and Flaming Gorge National Recreation Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Riverton.

area.areaDesc: Flaming Gorge; Rock Springs and Green River
